result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM 
Defendant Jeremy J. Hefel appeared by video from the Lafayette County Jail along with attorney Adam Witt for bond purposes only.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant and attorney Wit acknowledges criminal complaint and waives formal reading.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Defendant is provided with PD phone number and petition for court appointed counsel. 

State argues for $1,000.00 cash.
Attorney Witt argues for lesser amount of cash if not signature bond.

Court Orders:
-$1,000.00 Cash
-No contact with victims or property located at 228 E Main St., Benton, WI
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Victims listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the property located at 228 East Main Street, Benton, WI.
